tidyHeatmap 1.1.2

    • Overview of the tidyHeatmap package

Save plot on PDF file

Source: R/methods.R
save_pdf-methods.Rd

save_pdf() takes as input a Heatmap from ComplexHeatmap and save it to PDF file

save_pdf(
  .heatmap,
  filename,
  width = NULL,
  height = NULL,
  units = c("in", "cm", "mm")
)

Arguments

.heatmap

A `Heatmap`
filename

A character string. The name of the output file/path
width

A `double`. Plot width
height

A `double`. Plot height
units

A character string. units ("in", "cm", or "mm")

Value

NA

Details

It simply save an `Heatmap` to a PDF file use pdf() function in the back end

Examples



library(dplyr)
        tidyHeatmap::heatmap(
  dplyr::group_by(tidyHeatmap::pasilla,         location, type),
  .column = sample,
  .row = symbol,
  .value = `count normalised adjusted`,
 ) %>%
 save_pdf(tempfile())
#> tidyHeatmap says: saving 7 x 7 in image
